intro: Ricinocarpus polystachyus, commonly known as the white flame tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. The plant has a woody structure with compound leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The botanical features of Ricinocarpus polystachyus make it a distinctive and visually striking member of the legume family.
